author: yahoodie

review: I love the voice feature (which works far better than any other voice command system I've tried) and thus far seems far more stable, fast, and flexible than ChromeCast, because I could never get it to cast Amazon Prime vids from my desktop properly.  I'd rather be able to stream Netflix, Youtube, and Amazon Prime vids from the same device than cast my desktop to my tv anyway.  With ChromeCast, I missed having the ability to control it without opening an app on my phone/tablet, since I'm always multitasking while watching tv on it anyway and would have to interrupt what I was doing to change what I was watching, so although having to have a separate remote for it might be a drag for some, I enjoyed having a physical controller.  If streaming is to ever threaten Cable TV as a primary entertainment source, I believe Amazon Fire TV is by far a bigger contender in the race than ChromeCast, and is well worth the extra money.
author: Tawanda

review: Solid construction, heavy and sturdy.However this is not a toy, if you want to leave it for your kids to use it, they can get to any type of content since there are no parental controls whatsoever. All you can do is prevent unauthorized purchases by creating a 5 digit pin. As you browse through the options you have to watch, you'll get all kinds of posters of movies and tv series not appropriate for young kids.I got this amazon fire TV through the 30 day "free" trial and as I tried to return it, I realized I have to pay for returning it, which sucks.Amazon services are increasing price and dumping quality and customer satisfaction. Now I'm considering not renewing my prime subscription.
